page.title: 01ILFRACOMBE SEASIDE RESORT
page.content: Ilfracombe is situated on a rocky coast in North Devon.Every year tourists come in large numbers for their holidays and enjoy the beaches and beautiful country side.There are two harbours where boats are moored, one at Ilfracombe and the other at Watermouth.There are three main hills in Ilfracombe which you can see clearly,one is called Capstone the other is called Hillsborough,which was once an Iron Age Hill Fort,the other is called Lantern Hill, which has had a light on it to guide ships away from danger since the eleventh century.In our D block there is a little village called Hele.It has an old water mill which still grinds corn today.Most of the farmland is rough grazing for sheep,but at Watermouth there are llamas.
